revised_title: Dental Succession in Marsupialia: A Comparative Study
tldr: The author examines the dental development and succession in Marsupialia, a unique subclass of mammals. They describe the dentition process in six different families, highlighting the distinct characteristics of dental succession in these animals compared to other mammals. The study reveals that Marsupialia have a peculiar dental pattern, with only a single tooth on each side of each jaw undergoing vertical displacement and succession.
